metadata.title: Unified Control Framework Crosswalk
metadata.source: NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5, FedRAMP Rev 5, NIST SP 800-171 Rev 2, CMMC v2.0, DISA STIGs
metadata.description: Cross-framework control mapping enabling single implementation to satisfy multiple compliance requirements

crosswalk.title: Policy and Procedures
crosswalk.description: Develop, document, and disseminate access control policy and procedures.

crosswalk.title: Account Management
crosswalk.description: Manage system accounts including establishing, activating, modifying, reviewing, disabling, and removing accounts.

crosswalk.title: Access Enforcement
crosswalk.description: Enforce approved authorizations for logical access to information and system resources.

crosswalk.title: Information Flow Enforcement
crosswalk.description: Enforce approved authorizations for controlling the flow of information within the system and between systems.

crosswalk.title: Separation of Duties
crosswalk.description: Separate duties of individuals to reduce the risk of malevolent activity.

crosswalk.title: Least Privilege
crosswalk.description: Employ the principle of least privilege, allowing only authorized accesses necessary to accomplish assigned tasks.

crosswalk.title: Unsuccessful Logon Attempts
crosswalk.description: Enforce a limit of consecutive invalid logon attempts within a time period and automatically lock the account.

crosswalk.title: System Use Notification
crosswalk.description: Display system use notification message or banner before granting access.

crosswalk.title: Device Lock
crosswalk.description: Prevent further access to the system by initiating a device lock after a period of inactivity.

crosswalk.title: Session Termination
crosswalk.description: Automatically terminate a user session after organization-defined conditions or trigger events.

crosswalk.title: Remote Access
crosswalk.description: Establish and document usage restrictions, configuration/connection requirements, and implementation guidance for remote access.

crosswalk.title: Wireless Access
crosswalk.description: Establish configuration requirements, connection requirements, and implementation guidance for wireless access.

crosswalk.title: Access Control for Mobile Devices
crosswalk.description: Establish configuration requirements, connection requirements, and implementation guidance for mobile devices.

crosswalk.title: Use of External Systems
crosswalk.description: Establish terms and conditions for authorized individuals to access the system from external systems.

crosswalk.title: Publicly Accessible Content
crosswalk.description: Designate individuals authorized to post information onto a publicly accessible system and review content for nonpublic information.

crosswalk.title: Literacy Training and Awareness
crosswalk.description: Provide security and privacy literacy training to system users including insider threat awareness.

crosswalk.title: Role-Based Training
crosswalk.description: Provide role-based security and privacy training to personnel with assigned security roles and responsibilities.

crosswalk.title: Training Records
crosswalk.description: Document and monitor individual training activities including security and privacy training.

crosswalk.title: Event Logging
crosswalk.description: Identify the types of events that the system is capable of logging in support of the audit function.

crosswalk.title: Content of Audit Records
crosswalk.description: Ensure audit records contain information establishing what, when, where, source, outcome, and identity of event.

crosswalk.title: Audit Log Storage Capacity
crosswalk.description: Allocate audit log storage capacity to accommodate anticipated audit log volume.

crosswalk.title: Response to Audit Logging Process Failures
crosswalk.description: Alert designated personnel in the event of an audit logging process failure and take additional defined actions.

crosswalk.title: Audit Record Review, Analysis, and Reporting
crosswalk.description: Review and analyze system audit records for indications of inappropriate or unusual activity.

crosswalk.title: Audit Record Reduction and Report Generation
crosswalk.description: Provide and implement an audit record reduction and report generation capability.

crosswalk.title: Time Stamps
crosswalk.description: Use internal system clocks to generate time stamps for audit records and synchronize with authoritative time source.

crosswalk.title: Protection of Audit Information
crosswalk.description: Protect audit information and audit logging tools from unauthorized access, modification, and deletion.

crosswalk.title: Audit Record Retention
crosswalk.description: Retain audit records for an organization-defined time period to support after-the-fact investigations.

crosswalk.title: Audit Record Generation
crosswalk.description: Provide audit record generation capability for the events identified in AU-2 at system components.

crosswalk.title: Control Assessments
crosswalk.description: Assess security and privacy controls to determine effectiveness in application.

crosswalk.title: Information Exchange
crosswalk.description: Approve and manage the exchange of information between the system and other systems using ISAs, MOUs, or similar agreements.

crosswalk.title: Plan of Action and Milestones
crosswalk.description: Develop a plan of action and milestones for the system to document planned remedial actions.

crosswalk.title: Authorization
crosswalk.description: Assign a senior official as the authorizing official for the system and ensure authorization before operations.

crosswalk.title: Continuous Monitoring
crosswalk.description: Develop a system-level continuous monitoring strategy and implement continuous monitoring program.

crosswalk.title: Penetration Testing
crosswalk.description: Conduct penetration testing at organization-defined frequency on organization-defined systems.

crosswalk.title: Baseline Configuration
crosswalk.description: Develop, document, and maintain a current baseline configuration of the system.

crosswalk.title: Configuration Change Control
crosswalk.description: Determine and document the types of changes to the system that are configuration-controlled.

crosswalk.title: Impact Analyses
crosswalk.description: Analyze changes to the system to determine potential security and privacy impacts prior to change implementation.

crosswalk.title: Access Restrictions for Change
crosswalk.description: Define, document, approve, and enforce physical and logical access restrictions associated with changes.

crosswalk.title: Configuration Settings
crosswalk.description: Establish and document configuration settings for components reflecting the most restrictive mode consistent with requirements.

crosswalk.title: Least Functionality
crosswalk.description: Configure the system to provide only mission-essential capabilities, restricting use of nonessential functions, ports, protocols, and services.

crosswalk.title: System Component Inventory
crosswalk.description: Develop and document an inventory of system components that accurately reflects the system.

crosswalk.title: User-Installed Software
crosswalk.description: Establish and enforce a policy governing the installation of software by users.

crosswalk.title: Policy and Procedures
crosswalk.description: Develop, document, and disseminate a contingency planning policy and procedures.

crosswalk.title: Contingency Plan
crosswalk.description: Develop a contingency plan identifying essential missions, business functions, and associated contingency requirements.

crosswalk.title: Contingency Plan Testing
crosswalk.description: Test the contingency plan using organization-defined tests to determine effectiveness and organizational readiness.

crosswalk.title: System Backup
crosswalk.description: Conduct backups of user-level, system-level, and system documentation information.

crosswalk.title: System Recovery and Reconstitution
crosswalk.description: Provide for the recovery and reconstitution of the system to a known state within defined time period.

crosswalk.title: Identification and Authentication (Organizational Users)
crosswalk.description: Uniquely identify and authenticate organizational users and associate that identification with processes acting on their behalf.

crosswalk.title: Identifier Management
crosswalk.description: Manage system identifiers by receiving authorization, selecting, assigning, and preventing reuse.

crosswalk.title: Authenticator Management
crosswalk.description: Manage system authenticators by verifying identity, establishing initial authenticator content, and ensuring administrative procedures are in place.

crosswalk.title: Authentication Feedback
crosswalk.description: Obscure feedback of authentication information during the authentication process.

crosswalk.title: Identification and Authentication (Non-Organizational Users)
crosswalk.description: Uniquely identify and authenticate non-organizational users or processes acting on behalf of non-organizational users.

crosswalk.title: Policy and Procedures
crosswalk.description: Develop, document, and disseminate an incident response policy and procedures.

crosswalk.title: Incident Response Training
crosswalk.description: Provide incident response training to system users consistent with assigned roles and responsibilities.

crosswalk.title: Incident Response Testing
crosswalk.description: Test the effectiveness of the incident response capability.

crosswalk.title: Incident Handling
crosswalk.description: Implement an incident handling capability including preparation, detection, analysis, containment, eradication, and recovery.

crosswalk.title: Incident Monitoring
crosswalk.description: Track and document incidents on an ongoing basis.

crosswalk.title: Incident Reporting
crosswalk.description: Require personnel to report suspected incidents to the organizational incident response capability.

crosswalk.title: Incident Response Assistance
crosswalk.description: Provide an incident response support resource integral to the organizational incident response capability.

crosswalk.title: Controlled Maintenance
crosswalk.description: Schedule, document, and review records of maintenance, repair, and replacement on system components.

crosswalk.title: Maintenance Tools
crosswalk.description: Approve, control, and monitor the use of system maintenance tools.

crosswalk.title: Nonlocal Maintenance
crosswalk.description: Approve and monitor nonlocal maintenance and diagnostic activities.

crosswalk.title: Maintenance Personnel
crosswalk.description: Establish a process for maintenance personnel authorization and maintain a list of authorized personnel.

crosswalk.title: Timely Maintenance
crosswalk.description: Obtain maintenance support and spare parts for system components within defined time period of failure.

crosswalk.title: Media Access
crosswalk.description: Restrict access to digital and non-digital media to organization-defined types of individuals.

crosswalk.title: Media Marking
crosswalk.description: Mark system media indicating distribution limitations, handling caveats, and applicable security markings.

crosswalk.title: Media Storage
crosswalk.description: Physically control and securely store digital and non-digital media within controlled areas.

crosswalk.title: Media Transport
crosswalk.description: Protect and control digital and non-digital media during transport outside of controlled areas.

crosswalk.title: Media Sanitization
crosswalk.description: Sanitize system media prior to disposal, release out of organizational control, or release for reuse.

crosswalk.title: Media Use
crosswalk.description: Restrict the use of certain types of media on system components.

crosswalk.title: Physical Access Authorizations
crosswalk.description: Develop, approve, and maintain a list of individuals with authorized access to the facility.

crosswalk.title: Physical Access Control
crosswalk.description: Enforce physical access authorizations at entry/exit points using physical access control systems.

crosswalk.title: Monitoring Physical Access
crosswalk.description: Monitor physical access to the facility to detect and respond to physical security incidents.

crosswalk.title: Alternate Work Site
crosswalk.description: Employ management, operational, and technical controls at alternate work sites.

crosswalk.title: Policy and Procedures
crosswalk.description: Develop, document, and disseminate a planning policy and procedures.

crosswalk.title: System Security and Privacy Plans
crosswalk.description: Develop security and privacy plans for the system consistent with the enterprise architecture.

crosswalk.title: Rules of Behavior
crosswalk.description: Establish and provide rules describing responsibilities and expected behavior for system access.

crosswalk.title: Information Security Program Plan
crosswalk.description: Develop and disseminate an organization-wide information security program plan.

crosswalk.title: Risk Management Strategy
crosswalk.description: Develop a comprehensive strategy to manage risk to organizational operations, assets, and individuals.

crosswalk.title: Threat Awareness Program
crosswalk.description: Implement a threat awareness program with cross-organization information-sharing capability.

crosswalk.title: Personnel Screening
crosswalk.description: Screen individuals prior to authorizing access to the system.

crosswalk.title: Personnel Termination
crosswalk.description: Upon termination, disable system access, terminate authenticators, conduct exit interviews, and retrieve property.

crosswalk.title: Personnel Transfer
crosswalk.description: Review and confirm ongoing operational need for access authorizations when individuals are reassigned or transferred.

crosswalk.title: Policy and Procedures
crosswalk.description: Develop, document, and disseminate PII processing and transparency policy and procedures.

crosswalk.title: Authority to Process PII
crosswalk.description: Determine and document the legal authority that permits collection, use, maintenance, and sharing of PII.

crosswalk.title: Risk Assessment
crosswalk.description: Conduct a risk assessment identifying threats, vulnerabilities, and potential impacts to organizational operations.

crosswalk.title: Vulnerability Monitoring and Scanning
crosswalk.description: Monitor and scan for vulnerabilities in the system and hosted applications and remediate discovered vulnerabilities.

crosswalk.title: Risk Response
crosswalk.description: Respond to findings from security assessments, monitoring, and audits in accordance with risk tolerance.

crosswalk.title: Allocation of Resources
crosswalk.description: Determine high-level information security and privacy requirements for the system in mission/business process planning.

crosswalk.title: Acquisition Process
crosswalk.description: Include security and privacy requirements in acquisition contracts for system development and services.

crosswalk.title: Security and Privacy Engineering Principles
crosswalk.description: Apply systems security and privacy engineering principles in specification, design, development, implementation, and modification.

crosswalk.title: External System Services
crosswalk.description: Require providers of external system services to comply with organizational security and privacy requirements.

crosswalk.title: Developer Testing and Evaluation
crosswalk.description: Require the developer to create and implement a security and privacy assessment plan.

crosswalk.title: Separation of System and User Functionality
crosswalk.description: Separate user functionality including user interface services from system management functionality.

crosswalk.title: Information in Shared System Resources
crosswalk.description: Prevent unauthorized and unintended information transfer via shared system resources.

crosswalk.title: Boundary Protection
crosswalk.description: Monitor and control communications at the external managed interfaces and at key internal managed interfaces.

crosswalk.title: Transmission Confidentiality and Integrity
crosswalk.description: Protect the confidentiality and integrity of transmitted information.

crosswalk.title: Network Disconnect
crosswalk.description: Terminate the network connection at the end of the session or after a defined period of inactivity.

crosswalk.title: Cryptographic Key Establishment and Management
crosswalk.description: Establish and manage cryptographic keys when cryptography is employed within the system.

crosswalk.title: Cryptographic Protection
crosswalk.description: Implement organization-defined types of cryptography required for each specified cryptographic use.

crosswalk.title: Collaborative Computing Devices and Applications
crosswalk.description: Prohibit remote activation of collaborative computing devices and applications with defined exceptions.

crosswalk.title: Mobile Code
crosswalk.description: Define acceptable and unacceptable mobile code and technologies and establish usage restrictions.

crosswalk.title: Session Authenticity
crosswalk.description: Protect the authenticity of communications sessions.

crosswalk.title: Protection of Information at Rest
crosswalk.description: Protect the confidentiality and integrity of organization-defined information at rest.

crosswalk.title: Process Isolation
crosswalk.description: Maintain a separate execution domain for each executing system process.

crosswalk.title: Flaw Remediation
crosswalk.description: Identify, report, and correct system flaws; test updates for effectiveness and side effects before installation.

crosswalk.title: Malicious Code Protection
crosswalk.description: Implement malicious code protection mechanisms at system entry and exit points.

crosswalk.title: System Monitoring
crosswalk.description: Monitor the system to detect attacks, indicators of potential attacks, and unauthorized connections.

crosswalk.title: Security Alerts, Advisories, and Directives
crosswalk.description: Receive system security alerts, advisories, and directives from external organizations on an ongoing basis.

crosswalk.title: Software, Firmware, and Information Integrity
crosswalk.description: Employ integrity verification tools to detect unauthorized changes to software, firmware, and information.

crosswalk.title: Information Input Validation
crosswalk.description: Check the validity of organization-defined information inputs.

crosswalk.title: Information Management and Retention
crosswalk.description: Manage and retain information within the system in accordance with applicable laws, regulations, and standards.

crosswalk.title: Memory Protection
crosswalk.description: Implement controls to protect the system memory from unauthorized code execution.

crosswalk.title: Policy and Procedures
crosswalk.description: Develop, document, and disseminate a supply chain risk management policy and procedures.

crosswalk.title: Supply Chain Controls and Processes
crosswalk.description: Establish a process for identifying and addressing weaknesses or deficiencies in supply chain elements.

crosswalk.title: Acquisition Strategies, Tools, and Methods
crosswalk.description: Employ acquisition strategies and procurement methods to protect against and mitigate supply chain risks.

crosswalk.title: Component Authenticity
crosswalk.description: Develop and implement anti-counterfeit policy and procedures to detect and prevent counterfeit components.
